poem:
"Under the Shadow of Steel"

Caught in a warp of steel and stone,
Our Oleksandr, underground, alone.
The red city seized, in whispers, we tread,
In the bowels of Azovstal, our anxious bed.

Netted in tunnels, we live with the rats,
With the taste of fear, and sparsity of rats.
Gambling on hope, on a stakeout, we vie,
Mariupol sings a subterranean cry.
